result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul L. Frank

records.addlTxt:
2:00 PM Defendant Paul L. Frank appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Skorr appeared by video for Paul L. Frank.  Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
INDUCEMENT: No
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
The charges in the Information will be the same as the charges in the Criminal Complaint.  Not guilty plea(s).
Further proceedings scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling conference on January 17, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Further proceedings on December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED
The defendant Paul L Frank, shall appear before the Honorable Mark R. Rohrer, Manitowoc County Courthouse, Branch 1, on October 31, 2022 at 1:30 p.m. for an Initial Appearance.

Defendant Paul L. Frank not in court.  Attorney Heather M Faeh in court for Paul L. Frank.  Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant refuses to appear for hearing today.  
IA reset to 10-31-2022 at 1:30pm.  (State to draft order to appear)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
re felony criminal damage to property

The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 10-05-2022
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 10-05-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 7 counts burglary, criminal damage to property, possess methamphetamine.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-10-2022 at 1:30pm.  Bail is set at $1,000 cash with the conditions that he/she have no contact with North Rapids Road Storage Units and must maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Minutes.
